resources.string: Our goal is to help you gather data about your school climate through observation and social interaction.
This tool can then be used to create an action plan focusing on locations and/or indicators.
1. Once you\'ve created a new walk through, you can scroll through and select from a list of locations where observations will be conducted.
2. Once you\'ve chosen a location, rank and prioritize each environmental indicator or observed behavior.
3. Use the Action Plan space to note possible actions to resolve specific issues.
4. It is best to conduct the observations when students and staff are using the space as they normally would.
5. Ideally, the walk-through will be completed in one day by the same person or persons. If this is not possible, try and complete the walk- through during one week.

You may set a priority level for each item in the walk-through to help determine how soon action items need to be addressed. Only items with a red or yellow priority will be shown in your list of action items.
